description.content: Submits a mailing job (multi doc merge). The request body contains job parameters including document source, recipient address information, and payment details.

response.name: Success

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

body.raw:
{
  "mergeDocumentSource": [
    "<integer>",
    "<integer>"
  ],
  "recipientAddressSource": {
    "firstName": "John",
    "lastName": "Smith",
    "address1": "123 Main Street",
    "address2": "Apt 4B",
    "address3": "",
    "city": "New York",
    "state": "NY",
    "zip": "10001",
    "country": "USA",
    "nickName": "Johnny",
    "phoneNumber": "+1-555-123-4567"
  },
  "jobTemplate": "template_LiNAm24X",
  "paymentDetails": {
    "googlePayDetails": {
      "googlePaymentDetails": {}
    }
  },
  "returnAddress": {
    "firstName": "Hugh",
    "lastName": "Heidenreich",
    "address1": "1853 Jean Ranch",
    "city": "North Chad",
    "state": "Ohio",
    "zip": "43922-9208",
    "country": "Lithuania",
    "company": "Treutel - Fritsch",
    "address2": "353 Kayden Ranch",
    "address3": "18319 3rd Avenue"
  },
  "jobOptions": {
    "documentClass": "basic",
    "layout": "default",
    "productionTime": "2026-02-18T17:42:55.440Z",
    "envelope": "primary",
    "color": "primary",
    "paperType": "default",
    "printOption": "default",
    "mailClass": "standard"
  },
  "tags": [
    "<string>",
    "<string>"
  ]
}

Exchange a valid long-term token for a short-lived JWT (e.g., 15 minutes).
The long-term token must be sent in the Authorization header as `Bearer <long_token>`.

response.name: Short-term token issued

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

  "token_type": "Bearer",
  "access_token": "default",
  "expires_in": "standard",
  "expires_at": "<dateTime>",
  "scopes": [
    "<string>",
    "<string>"
  ],
  "token_id": "ZqEWp2hBI6"
}

item.name: Issue or rotate a long-term token

request.name: Issue or rotate a long-term token

description.content:
Issues a long-term token (e.g., 30-90 days) for automation or server-to-server use.
Requires step-up authentication. Choose one of the supported grant types:

- `client_credentials` + `client_secret`
- `client_credentials` + one-time `otp_code`
- `assertion` (e.g., signed JWT by your private key)
- Or an existing short-term token with the `tokens:write` scope

Only one mechanism is required per call.

body.raw:
{
  "grant_type": "client_credentials",
  "client_id": "t83iPIHUkE",
  "client_secret": "primary",
  "otp_code": "default",
  "assertion_type": "standard",
  "assertion": "basic",
  "scopes": [
    "<string>",
    "<string>"
  ],
  "ttl_seconds": "default"
}

response.name: Long-term token issued

item.name: Issue or rotate a long-term token

exec: // JWT endpoints have different allowed status codes
pm.test('Status code is allowed (200,201,400,401,429)', function () { pm.expect([200, 201, 400, 401, 429]).to.include(pm.response.code); });
pm.test('Rate limit response has Retry-After header', function () {
// JWT revoke endpoint returns 204 No Content on success, 404 for non-existent tokens
pm.test('Status code is allowed (200,204,400,401,404)', function () { pm.expect([200, 204, 400, 401, 404]).to.include(pm.response.code); });

// Helper function to get short-term token
scopes: ['jobs:submit'] // Narrow scope for actual API calls
console.error('Failed to get short-term token:', err);
console.error('Failed to get short-term token:', response.text());
// Check if we need client credentials
console.warn('Client credentials not configured. Set clientId and clientSecret in environment.');
// Check if we need to refresh tokens
